To Tim Heaton
Not wishing to object to anyone's decided or destined
path through life, in terms of living the life of a
samurai, who are you to serve, who would be your
master (or perhaps mistress, this is the 21st
Century)? Devoid of a master, a samurai('one who
serves') became a ronin ('wave man') and as the
Tokugawa period evolved and the state demilitarized,
being a ronin often led to little more than crime,
debauchery, poverty, or jobs in teaching or medicine. 
Good luck whatever happens
M.Lorimer  


 --- TIMOTHY HEATON <jahladracul@...> wrote: 
---------------------------------
hi my name is timothy heaton of the email
jahladracul@...
i have inquired this listing of samurai history on my
personal behalf for seeking the answers to the meaning
of my life.i sincerly seek the way of the samurai,i am
very serius ,i have much to change about myself and i
have tried to live as a smurai would live according to
what i have learned before and it makes sense to me
but needs get in the way especialy in america and
since there are few places to go for peace anymore.i
love the earth and i have proven that by living 25
years without a drivers liscense and the ownership of
a pollutting vehichle,i ride a bycycle or walk ,once
in awhile i except rides,but i insist on standing my
ground for what i believe even when others throw it in
my face.i strongly believe in the way of the samurai
and i choose to be a true samurai no matter what i
must do, the way of a samurai in which i have
attempted has made me feel a like i found were i
belong and it means more to me than anything else in
all of which ive learned in life.sincerly tim heaton
